data.question: Why is dry HCl gas not acidic in nature?
data.op_1: Because it does not dissolve in water
data.op_2: Because it does not contain hydrogen
data.ans: Because it does not dissolve in water

data.question: Which of the following salts will give acidic solution in water?
Why is Plaster of Paris stored in airtight containers?
data.op_1: To prevent it from absorbing CO₂
data.op_2: To prevent it from hardening by absorbing moisture
data.op_3: To prevent it from reacting with oxygen
data.op_4: To prevent it from losing whiteness
data.ans: To prevent it from hardening by absorbing moisture

data.question: The pH of a solution is 3. What will be its hydrogen ion concentration?
Which acid is used for removing oxide layer from metal surfaces before galvanisation?
Why does tooth enamel get corroded when pH in the mouth falls below 5.5?
data.op_1: Because it reacts with acids formed by bacteria
data.op_4: Because it is insoluble in alkali
data.ans: Because it reacts with acids formed by bacteria

data.question: Which one of the following salts gives basic solution in water?
Why is baking powder used in making cakes?
data.op_1: It produces CO₂ and makes the cake soft and spongy
data.ans: It produces CO₂ and makes the cake soft and spongy

data.question: Which chemical is used to neutralize the effect of acid rain on lakes?
Which salt is used to remove hardness of water?
Why does aqueous solution of NaCl not show acidic or basic nature?
data.op_1: Because NaCl is a neutral salt
data.op_2: Because NaCl is a strong base
data.op_3: Because NaCl is a weak acid
data.ans: Because NaCl is a neutral salt
